I can guide you through your application ,answer questions about the application process, connect you to admission officers
I Offer information about exciting degree, diploma and certificate programs we have here at Univen!
Please note that we are not taking paper applications currently! Online applications only at www.univen.ac.za, before 30 September
Applications open annually between March and 30 september

Bsc. Computer Science/Comuter Science and Mathematics, why not check out our prospectus here :[https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Univen_2022_Undergraduate_Student_Brochure.pdf] for all our study programs.
Univen offers a Bsc. Computer Science and a Bsc. Computer Science and Mathematics
For a Bsc. ,you can choose to major in Computer Science or Computer Science and Mathematics
Why not check out our prospectus here :[https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Univen_2022_Undergraduate_Student_Brochure.pdf] for all our study programs.
Before applying, you are required to pay an application fee of R 100, at ABSA. Account Number : 1000 000 589. Use your ID No as reference.
We have different social clubs and sports teams you can join
You can become a member of our many sports teams like the football, netball, volleyball teams and many other clubs

Univen has several fuculties:Faculty of Management, Commerce and Law, Faculty of Science, Engineering and Agriculture, Faculty of Humanities, Social Science and Education, and the  Faculty of Health Sciences

intents.tag: Faculty of Management, Commerce and Law
responses: School of law : [https://www.univen.ac.za/faculties/management-commerce-and-law/]
The school of law offers various degrees in Mercantile and Private Law, Public law and Criminal Justice
To learn more about the degrees in the school of law, take a look [https://www.univen.ac.za/faculties/management-commerce-and-law/]

intents.tag: Faculty of Science, Engineering and Agriculture
responses: Bachelor of Science in Agriculture (various specializations), Bachelor of Science in Forestry, Bachelor of Science in Food Science and Technology,Bachelor of Science in Agricultural and Biosystems Engineering, Bachelor of Agriculture Honours
Take a look at our School of agriculture calender here : [https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/2021-School-of-Agriculture-Calendar.pdf]

intents.tag: Faculty of Science, Engineering and Agric
responses: The school of mathematics offers a Diploma in Fresh Water Technology and Bachelor of Science degrees, Extended Bachelor of Science degree in different specialisations, more here : [https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/2021-Univen-Mathematical-and-Natural-Sciences-Calendar.pdf]

We offer Bsc. with different specialisations  such as Zoology, computer Science, Agriculture , Biokinetics, nutrition and many others that can be found on the brochure here : [https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Univen_2022_Undergraduate_Student_Brochure.pdf]

Candidates wishing to enrol for a BSc degree must have obtained a minimum admission requirement in a National Senior Certificate (NSC) with an achievement rating of 4 (adequate achievement, 50-59%) or better in each of the following four recognised 20-credit NSC subjects: English,Mathematics, Physical Science and Life Sciences
Check out the school calender here : [https://www.univen.ac.za/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/2021-Univen-Mathematical-and-Natural-Sciences-Calendar.pdf]
We offer degrees spread across different departments Biochemistry, Botany, Chemistry, Computer Science and Information,Mathematics and Applied Mathematics, Microbiology, Physics, Statistics, Zoology
Univen offers a variety of  student residences that are fully furnished with access to Wi-Fi, and you can apply here [https://www.univen.ac.za/housing-and-accommodation/]
Univen offers off-campus residences and campus-based residences that you can apply for here : [https://www.univen.ac.za/housing-and-accommodation/]
Please note that the application form for residence is separate from the admission form and it is available on here :[https://www.univen.ac.za/housing-and-accommodation/]

Please make sure you have copies of  your final grade 11 results, you ID/passport, proof of payment from ABSA, your academic record if you have been previously registered at a tertiary institution and a testimonial from your previous institution. All in PDF

Supporting documents include : an application fee -; non-refundable , Copy of page 1 of Identity Document/Passport, a testimonial of good conduct, a Matriculation/NSC/NCV certificate or, if not yet available, some form of proof that the prospective student complies with the necessary requirements for the degree for which s/he desire to register for or a statement of last school symbol achieved.
All our applications are online, you can apply between March and September 30th here : [https://univenien.univen.ac.za/pls/prodi04/gen.gw1pkg.gw1view]
Please ensure that all your supporting documents are in pdf format before you apply here : [https://univenien.univen.ac.za/pls/prodi04/gen.gw1pkg.gw1view]

patterns: how to qualify for a degree
responses: The minimum admission requirement is a National Senior Certificate (NSC) as certified by the Council for General and Further Education and Training (Umalusi) with an achievement rating of 4 (adequate achievement, 50-59%) or better in four subjects chosen from the recognised 20-credit NSC subjects. In addition, applicants must have a minimum point score of 26. A grade 12 certificate with a bachelor or matric exemption is required if grade 12 has been achieved.

patterns: how to qualify for a diploma
responses: The minimum admission requirement is a National Senior Certificate (NSC) as certified by Umalusi with an achievement rating of 3 (moderate achievement, 40-49%) or better in four recognised NSC 20-credit subjects.

patterns: how to qualify for a certificate
responses: The minimum admission requirement is a National Senior Certificate (NSC) as certified by Umalusi.To be considered for admission to specific programmes, applicants are required to have the appropriate combinations of recognised National Senior Certificate subjects as well as certain levels of achievement in these subjects.

Univen has prestigious library facilities where you can access thousands of books and academic articles, our internet equipped computers for all your assignments needs or just to study! You can find out more about the library on our website.
For more on our library you can visit the library section on the univen's website
